text: Long considered an anachronism from a bygone era , quarantine has re - emerged in the 21 st century as an important ( albeit controversial ) tool in the battle against infectious disease . Prior to the 2003 outbreak of severe acute respiratory syndrome ( SARS ) , it had been more than 50 years since mass quarantine measures had been invoked in North America [ 1 ] . The SARS containment measures imposed in Canada and Asia , and on a lesser scale in the U . S . , provoked a heated debate within the public health community regarding the ethics and legality of quarantine [ 2 ] [ 3 ] [ 4 ] [ 5 ] [ 6 ] [ 7 ] .
